reverse proxy abstract out the downstream systems , so for example if you are hitting a url , from there the proxy might route it to any server accordingly.
so reverse proxies are like load balancers and api gateways, 

here the user need not know from where does the response come, it might come from server 1, 2 or ...

it can also implement caching , eg if a blog is frequently hit, the response might get returned directly from the load balancer, 

reverse proxy is commonly used

<img src="data:image/png;base64,"/>



[[Forward Proxy]]
